summary: Improves the enchantment on the Necromancer's Amulet, making it useful rather than just annoying. Goodbye two-bit warlock; hello Mannimarco!
descriptionHtml:
[size=6][b][color=#c27ba0]Powerful Necromancer's Amulet[/color][/b][/size]

[size=3][color=#8e7cc3][size=5][b]What is this? [/b][/size][/color][size=3]
[size=2]Previously, there were some nasty drawbacks to using the necromancer's amulet, including reduced health regeneration. And let's face it, the good parts of the enchantment weren't all that great. Now, once you get the amulet, you'll be able to have 2 zombies long before you can get the Twin Souls perk, AND there are no icky consequences to using the amulet. Because let's face it, an amulet that supposedly belonged to Mannimarco wouldn't be nearly as wimpy as the one Bethesda gave us.[/size][/size][size=2]

[size=3]This mod changes the enchantment on the Necromancer's Amulet to make it more powerful. Now it gives you the following:[/size][/size][/size]
[list][*][size=2]+50 magicka[/size][/*]
[/list][list][*][size=2]Conjuration spells cost 25% less to cast[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Increases your undead summon limit by 1[/size][/*]
[/list]

[color=#8e7cc3][size=5][b]Installation[/b][/size][/color]
[list=1][*][size=2]Download[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Add the esp file to the Skyrim/Data folder, OR install with MO or NMM[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Done[/size]
[/*]
[/list]

[size=6][b][color=#c27ba0]FAQ[/color][/b][/size]
[b][color=#8e7cc3]Q: Does this change the mesh or texture of the amulet?[/color][/b]
A: No.
[color=#8e7cc3]
[b]Q: Is the mod compatible with x?[/b][/color]
A: As long as x doesn't edit the amulet, yes. Texture and mesh replacers are compatible.

[b][color=#8e7cc3]Q: This mod is lame.[/color][/b]
A: Your face is lame.

[color=#8e7cc3][b]Q: This mod crashed by game?![/b][/color]
A: No, it didn't. It literally edits 2 things in the game. I've cleaned it with TES5Edit. If something goes terribly wrong with your game, you've screwed the pooch somewhere and it's not my fault.
author: steelfeathers
